explains: adj. 可预测的，可预料的；老套乏味的，墨守成规的

sentences.en: This was a predictable reaction, given the bitter hostility between the two countries.
sentences.cn: 考虑到两国之间的强烈敌意，这种反应是可以预见的。

sentences.en: The ending of the book was entirely predictable.
sentences.cn: 那本书的结局完全是可以想见的。

sentences.en: The show was well performed, but so safe and predictable.
sentences.cn: 演出不错，只是太四平八稳，缺少新意。
